text:
<@U25PYL3Q8> thanks found the solution (still new to coding so it takes a while haha :sweat_smile: )

so yea i didnt bring it in haha thats why it wasn't working thought if i select it at the top it would automatically be included in the code and that it doesnt have to be labeled as a const

so my solution that worked:
```const HubSpot = require('@HubSpot/api-client');
const Access_Token = process.env.Access_Token;
const HubSpotClient = new HubSpot.Client({accessToken:Access_Token});```
Thanks again! :slightly_smiling_face:
I use custom properties in search and it works fine.

Hi everyone, the Property API is not returning deal stage options. Any clues?
```HTTP 200

{
  "updatedAt": "2023-08-11T16:42:34.454Z",
  "createdAt": "2019-08-06T02:41:52.266Z",
  "name": "dealstage",
  "label": "Deal Stage",
  "type": "enumeration",
  "fieldType": "radio",
  "description": "The stage of the deal. Deal stages allow you to categorize and track the progress of the deals that you are working on.",
  "groupName": "dealinformation",
  "options": [],
  "displayOrder": 3,
  "calculated": false,
  "externalOptions": true,
  "hasUniqueValue": false,
  "hidden": false,
  "HubSpotDefined": true,
  "modificationMetadata": {
    "archivable": true,
    "readOnlyDefinition": true,
    "readOnlyOptions": false,
    "readOnlyValue": false
  },
  "formField": false
}```
Sorry, I missed that update 8 days ago otherwise I would have pointed you in teh right direction. Nice work on solving this. It all gets easier (or more complicated) over time :slightly_smiling_face:

```Testing in the dev docs page I get the same for both dealstage and pipeline.  But dealtype worked: HTTP 200

{
  "updatedAt": "2023-06-20T22:11:07.210Z",
  "createdAt": "2019-08-06T02:41:52.542Z",
  "name": "dealtype",
  "label": "Deal Type",
  "type": "enumeration",
  "fieldType": "radio",
  "description": "The type of deal. By default, categorize your deal as either a New Business or Existing Business.",
  "groupName": "dealinformation",
  "options": [
    {
      "label": "New Business",
      "value": "newbusiness",
      "displayOrder": 0,
      "hidden": false
    },
    {
      "label": "Existing Business",
      "value": "existingbusiness",
      "displayOrder": 1,
      "hidden": false
    }
  ],
  "displayOrder": 8,
  "calculated": false,
  "externalOptions": false,
  "hasUniqueValue": false,
  "hidden": false,
  "HubSpotDefined": true,
  "modificationMetadata": {
    "archivable": true,
    "readOnlyDefinition": true,
    "readOnlyOptions": false,
    "readOnlyValue": false
  },
  "formField": false
}```

Hallo :slightly_smiling_face:,
I try to update the secondary email field for a contact using the api. I already found the legacy api to do this (<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/preview/preview-overview>), but nothing in the new api docs. Can you help me with this?
<@UQNEXHW14> could you please review this and let us know if this is how its intended to work? I didnt find anything on the api docs.

Hello,
I am currently trying to create a draft email via the api with no luck….HOWEVER the contact from HubSpot chat mentioned I may need a *transactional email add on* (paid), not sure if he was fully aware of my needs or not …. but that might be something to look at?
How ambitious would it be to use the HubSpot API to draft new blog posts based on existing blog posts? (transferring tags, content, authors, etc.)

I am using the add to contact list API...I was wondering what the "discarded" array means in the response below.
```{ 
    updated: [],
    discarded: [],
    invalidVids: [],
    invalidEmails: [] 
}```
Any insight would be greatly appreciated.

Hi! New to this slack ground, apologies if this is the wrong channel.. I am working on developing a 3 way api third party and we have a gap with folks changing / needing 2 emails (one for app, one for their payment processing)

If I make the API pick up on the email change, and add that email as primary and move current email address to secondary, do you all know if _both_ email addresses can be used as a unique ID for the record?
is this the right thread for crm development?
Does HubSpot have any way I can get the complete page HTML body via API request for a particular page ID and update the HTML as well? I want to add HubL via API for my page data??
